body_html: I think a custom op for this is overkill. Just do matrix * tf.expand_dims(threshold / tf.maximum(threshold, norms), 1). Hmm. I guess for norms one has to do tf.sqrt(tf.reduce_sum(tf.square(matrix), 1) which isn't pretty, but if any new op is added here it should be an L2 norm op (or possibly some extra arguments the existing L2Loss op), not a normalization op.

body: I think a custom op for this is overkill.  Just do `matrix * tf.expand_dims(threshold / tf.maximum(threshold, norms), 1)`.  Hmm.  I guess for norms one has to do `tf.sqrt(tf.reduce_sum(tf.square(matrix), 1)` which isn't pretty, but if any new op is added here it should be an L2 norm op (or possibly some extra arguments the existing `L2Loss` op), not a normalization op.
